description: From Old French bracelet, diminutive form of bras (“arm”).

entries.meaning: A band or chain worn around the wrist as jewelry/jewellery or an ornament.
The strap of a wristwatch, used to secure it around the wrist.
(historical) A piece of defensive armour for the arm.

verbs.description: bracelet (third-person singular simple present bracelets, present participle braceleting or braceletting, simple past and past participle braceleted or braceletted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To surround with, or as if with, a bracelet; to ring or encompass.
